passage:
(1) Credit cards and loans are common financial tools that allow people to borrow money for different purposes. Credit cards are plastic cards issued by banks that let users make purchases without using cash immediately. When someone uses a credit card, they are borrowing money from the card issuer with the promise to pay it back later. Most credit cards have a credit limit, which is the maximum amount a person can borrow.

(2) When credit card users don't pay their full balance by the due date, they must pay interest on the remaining amount. Interest is a percentage of the borrowed money that the lender charges as a fee for lending the money. Credit card interest rates are usually higher than other types of loans, often between 15% and 25% annually. This is why financial experts recommend paying off credit card balances in full each month.

(3) Loans work differently from credit cards. A loan is a fixed amount of money that a person borrows and agrees to pay back over a specific period. Common types of loans include personal loans, student loans, auto loans, and mortgages. When someone takes out a loan, they typically receive the entire amount at once and then make regular monthly payments until the loan is fully repaid.

(4) Most loans have fixed interest rates, meaning the rate stays the same throughout the loan term. Some loans, however, have variable interest rates that can change based on market conditions. The interest rate for a loan is usually determined by factors such as the borrower's credit score, income, and the amount of money being borrowed. People with higher credit scores generally qualify for loans with lower interest rates.

(5) Both credit cards and loans can be useful financial tools when used responsibly. They can help people make important purchases, manage emergencies, or build credit history. However, they can also lead to financial problems if not managed properly. Taking on too much debt can result in high interest payments and damage to one's credit score. This is why it's important to understand how these financial products work before using them.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
Choose the correct form of the verb:

options.A: I have see that movie last week.
options.B: I have seen that movie last week.
options.C: I saw that movie last week.
options.D: I am seeing that movie last week.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:

options.A: If I will see him, I will tell him.
options.B: If I see him, I will tell him.
options.C: If I would see him, I will tell him.
options.D: If I saw him, I will tell him.

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition:
Which is the correct comparative form?

options.A: This building is more taller than that one.
options.B: This building is tallest than that one.
options.C: This building is more tall than that one.
options.D: This building is taller than that one.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:

options.A: I've been living here since three years.
options.B: I've been living here for three years.
options.C: I've been living here during three years.
options.D: I've been living here by three years.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:

options.A: She told me that she is coming tomorrow.
options.B: She told me that she was coming tomorrow.
options.C: She told me that she will coming tomorrow.
options.D: She told me that she comes tomorrow.

questions.question: Which modal verb is correct in this sentence? 'You ___ smoke in hospitals.'

options.B: Neither John nor Mary came to the party.
options.C: Neither John nor Mary didn't come to the party.
options.D: Neither John nor Mary comes to the party.

options.A: The letter writed by John arrived yesterday.

options.D: The letter writing by John arrived yesterday.

options.A: I wish I can speak French.
options.B: I wish I will speak French.

options.D: I wish I would speak French.

options.A: If I had studied harder, I will pass the exam.
options.B: If I had studied harder, I would passed the exam.
options.C: If I had studied harder, I pass the exam.
options.D: If I had studied harder, I would have passed the exam.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?

options.A: The children are too young for watch this movie.
options.B: The children are too young to watching this movie.
options.C: The children are too young to watch this movie.
options.D: The children are too young for to watch this movie.

questions.question: Choose the correct form:

options.A: By the time I arrived, they already left.
options.B: By the time I arrived, they had already left.
options.C: By the time I arrived, they have already left.
options.D: By the time I arrived, they were already leaving.

options.A: Where you did go last weekend?
options.B: Where did you went last weekend?
options.D: Where did you go last weekend?

options.A: A plastic card used only for cash withdrawals
options.B: A card that lets users make purchases without immediate cash payment
options.C: A card with unlimited borrowing potential
options.D: A type of loan with fixed monthly payments

options.A: Because credit cards have low interest rates
options.B: Because it improves your credit score
options.C: Because credit cards have high interest rates

options.C: Loans are borrowed as a fixed amount and repaid over a specific period

questions.question: Based on paragraph 5, what can happen if credit cards and loans are not managed properly?

options.A: They can help build credit history
options.B: They can lead to financial problems and credit score damage

options.A: To convince readers to avoid using credit cards and loans
options.B: To explain how credit cards and loans work and their proper use

options.B: A percentage fee charged for borrowing money
options.C: The credit limit on a card

questions.question: According to the passage, what is a fixed interest rate?

options.A: A rate that changes based on market conditions
options.B: A rate that stays the same throughout the loan term
options.C: A rate that only applies to credit cards
options.D: A rate that only applies to mortgages

questions.question: The passage suggests that people should:

options.A: Never use credit cards or loans
options.B: Only use loans, not credit cards
options.C: Understand financial products before using them
options.D: Borrow as much money as possible
